Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[discord] <Jcharming> Very cool, would you be willing to be reached out to here if I wanted to get more in depth information on the KMD project?  
For some background of why I'm asking, I'm a contributor on a few servers, a couple of which are sizable.  I run a daily newsletter publish and I've received a lot of questions about KMD tech when I was posting news information about kmdplatform these last 2 quarters (especially as I was covering the dICO releases).  My subjective take away is that there is substantial interest in the project, however the technical density doesn't translate well.  I'd love to formulate a more digestible understanding for myself, after which I'd be willing to share it out in my other publishes.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> sure, here or KMD discord, I am online a lot and accessible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> feel free to post questions, whenever. best to ask just a few at a time, instead of a wall of text. usually the answers to the questions end up changing the followups you want to ask anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Jcharming> Thank you I will, and we are in complete agreement about the last part of that statement. lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> I have used the simplest available solutions for the various KMD aspects, but it all ends up being a relatively complex system, even if it is built from "simple" things like SPV and checkpoints

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[discord] <Jcharming> And that makes complete sense to me, many of the projects that I review have shared similar sentiments, and they aren't developing a multi-chain platforms, or end-to-end blockchain services, or decentralized exchanges.  I can only imagine that the size of the system in a project like this only deepens the complexity.  Which also makes sense, as that result is what I have experienced.  It's reflected in both my own understanding coming into this project and starting research on it, and that of many other people that who have asked me questions about it after reading recent news exerts.   

I'd imagine the lack of 'digestibility' is what has even kept me away for a while, as KMD isn't a new name in the space.  It's just well known as 'complicated'. lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> for those interested (in a long read): i stumbled on this thread with a lot of questions and concerns wrt decentralized poker: https://forumserver.twoplustwo.com/29/news-views-gossip/decentralised-poker-future-1636827/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> Well obviously since local governments totally fucked up online poker. Most countries u can only play on domestic version of the platform/app so the players pool is limited. Times of Pokerstars being available to anyone are long gone. Not sure how this gonna work though, u need dedicated servers so how u gonna decentralized that?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> anyone can be a dealer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> Look the dealer is RNG machine that needs to be fully independent sort of..u can’t just have it run it by anyone lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> actually CHIPS design allows this

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> there is a math paper that describes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> dealer has no advantage over the players, his role is to provide a connection point for the table

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> notary nodes will run a blinds service, essentially just a set of random numbers, but they wont even know what hand it is for

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> MofN players are needed to decode a specific card

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> so as long as there are VPS providers in a non-hostile jurisdiction, dealer nodes (tables) can be created for games to be played

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> each dealer will set the table configuration and players can decide to play or not

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> we had a working system a couple years ago but we needed LN type of tech for the realtime betting and that is fine for using MofN multisig, but still has the problem of all the losing nodes rage quitting and the winner not able to collect. so we needed to wait for CC (enhanced cryptoconditions ) to be ready to be able to blockchain enforce payouts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> yesterday I saw the first CC cross chain contract tx, but still there are some  consensus issues, so likely a few more months before we have all the ingredients needed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> @ph03nix poker site makes money by collecting rake from pots or entry fee to tournaments. So, the more volume the more money they make. Cheating is negative EV. People cheating, using bots and collusion is a different thing, nothing to do with the site.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes and the dealer nodes that are good at setting up collusion free games will end up with more repeat players

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dealer node can set their rake on a per table basis

Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> It’s cool idea but been playing for all my adult life both live and online, I can tell you that poker players are extremely cautious and they won’t just play on some random node unless they fully trust it’s safe and secure from cheating. I don’t know, how do you convince them or how transparent is the process and can u observe the random deal etc. I am@not expert on technology but I am expert on poker I played as pro many years and dealt in both in casino and private games.
